column4: Can I get some opinions from any of you on why you use Ubuntu, and not Kubuntu?
it's a question of preference,  I like the look and feel of gnome,  and I don'T realy care for the look and feels of kde
Hmm, cause I installed Ubuntu off a DVD, heard lots that Kubuntu was better, did that, lots of stuff from Gnome didn't work, and now I just crashed Kubuntu and can't get back in
congrats , you crashed a linux distro, almost impossible
that is the first thing I heard of beryl on windows,  try asking in #beryl they might know (but expect a chuckle at the very least)
I don't know where I read it, but I SWEAR I saw somethings somewhere, I don't care too much I don't use Windows but they do.
My Roommates? They would except they play Doom 3 and Microsoft Flight Simulator, so if I can't get those to run well in Ubuntu they wont do it.
tell them they are lame and that all the cool kids are using ubuntu now
tell them the first one is free,  and so is the second and the third ...
At work, everywhere I go, Windows sucks, Microsoft sucks, switch to Ubuntu, although Microsoft's Surface is cool.
that's an RC level thing but I can't tell you how to do it
/etc/RC.d or rc.2 and such, those ar folder in which you put links to apps that you need started as services
No ideas on why network manager wont just connect to my network? if it's on roaming I think it sees it, but I have to click on my network name or it wont connect, it just tries and fails otherwise.
Alright thanks anyway, maybe I'll look into RC
run the cd integrety check on the ubuntu cd, from the boot menu
